What's the difference between CSS “em” and “rem”?
text:
I've read this much about this:

1) Learning Web Design Book by Jennifer Niederst Robbins

1 rem= 1* browser's default font size

1 em= depends on the element type, for h1 it's something, for h2, it's sth else.

2) https://css-tricks.com/confused-rem-em/

>While em is relative to the font-size of its direct or nearest parent, rem is only relative to the html (root) font-size.

I get the rem part, but not the em part. What does it mean?

3) https://blog.logrocket.com/using-em-vs-rem-css/#:~:text=Let%27s%20get%20started!-,What%20are%20em%20and%20rem%20and%20why%20use%20them%3F,relative%20to%20a%20set%20value.

I've read this as well but since I'm only knowing html and starting to learn css, I could not get most of the things written there.

4) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tlRLEsZa89M

I watch this short video. It does makes things somewhat clear about "inherits from parent".

Anyway, I am eager to learn the crux of "em". Maybe with some code examples, or figures(if it's lying anywhere in internet)

Ask HN: How to Start Contributing to FOSS as an Ubernoob?
text:
Basically title, but for some background:
I'm a student in post-secondary education that has dabbled in programming for about a decade, but never really completed any large projects. I've made simple shell scripts, but consider that "real" development work. When I tried looking at pull requests/issues and the respective APIs of FOSS projects such as GNOME or KDE apps, the code would just completely go over my head. I would have no idea how to even start solving the problem or where/what the bug even is! It just made me feel all the much more worse because I was too broke to donate to awesome projects I use, but also too moronic to contribute bug fixes. I would appreciate any and all advice, thanks!

Ask HN: Is YouTube also spamming you with non-CANSPAM-compliant emails?
text:
Woke up this morning to a marketing email I _can't_ unsubscribe from from YouTube/Google.

It's labeled as an "Important Account Update", but it has literally nothing to do with my account, it's a product announcement, which by definition is a marketing email.

Am I the only one getting these? CANSPAM unfortunately does not let individuals to sue or form classes (as I read the law), but I will be passing these to my State Attorney General and the FTC (whom are authorized to sue), and I encourage everyone else to do so as well.

Verified Account from on Bahariterra vs Havkhizara – Qasuriyyah War
text: It was August of year 2022 and we were fighting against Havkhizara in Bahariterra’s PecanVista Mountain range. Havkhizara is a racist, white supremacist and hate group based mainly in the United States and Canada. Havkhizara launches attacks on people in the Islamic Republic of the Bahariterra Islands as well as in mainland North America where they attack Bahariterran Americans in Ohio and Virginia where the bulk of Bahariterran immigrant communities in the USA are living. Havkhizara had been launching deadly terrorist attacks against Muslims from Bahariterra wherever they lived an many Americans volunteered to help the Bahariterran Government fight them. So, in the Bahariterran military, in early August of 2022, I fought Havkhizara in the Bahariterra Islands where they had killed my little brother. I was angry and I wanted revenge. I fought mainly in the coastal plains where all the big cities were but on this particular August day, it was unusually cold, and while that still means it is warm in most of the Bahariterra islands, the highest mountains are much colder than the relatively tropical climate near sea level. Havkhizara was taking advantage of the fact that it was August and weather was starting to cool down in the PecanVista mountains. They hid in the fallen leaves on the bare trees at elevations over 11,000 feet and they harvested ice that formed at night on creeks before the creeks warmed by afternoon. Havkhizara was deploying what my team called their “White Aryan Knights” who were the most beloved among the racist supremacists. One day, we were leaving the city of Crater Village, Bahariterra (located high in the cold mountains in a big volcanic crater,) and we got on a boat on Lake PecanVista (The largest freshwater lake on the islands which is created by rainwater filling the bottom of this volcanic crater and forming a lake next to Crater Village) and we were 450 men in 18 boats heading east across the lake. I was in the very back of the last boat so I was in charge of making sure no one would ambush us from behind or follow us. suddenly, a speedboat with two little girls begin pursuing us and the girls were screaming and fleeing from the village on the speedboat. They had on backpacks. Normally, a soldier in Bahariterran government would think to help them, but earlier that day we had just had an encounter with a bag pack full of bombs. We believed that these two little girls were suicide bombers. Havkhizara was getting desperate and forcing young Hindu children to attack us. I had to do my job so I raised an AK-47 and told them to turn around or else I would have to shoot them. They looked scared and they were crying and screaming and visibly frustrated, no doubt the Havkhizara fighters forced them to do this. I started putting pressure on the trigger on my gun and right before I was about to shoot them they stopped pursuing us and made the boat drift aimlessly as if they knew I was about to shoot and were scared to proceed. they turned around and I breathed a sigh of relief. I never hurt them but it was traumatizing and was the worst day being a Bahariterran soldier, for me.

title: Does anyone know of any accounting transaction specific databases?
text: Most accounting and GL systems have some proprietary DB for transactions, but getting at that raw data is often difficult, many don't even have an API.  I've been looking around for a more low-level solution for databases that are purpose built for accounting transactions.  The two I've found so far are properfinance.io and Modern Treasury has their Ledger product.  Any others?
